answer:
Shingrix® is recommended for adults 50 years of age or older including those who previously had shingles. Immunization may be considered at least one year after having shingles. The vaccine should not be given to those who currently have shingles. Read more about shingles here.
Immunization Nurse
question: I developed shingles on October 2, took an antiviral followed by gabapentin and am symptom free since December 1st. When can I get the shingrix vaccine to prevent a recurrence?
question_variation_0: can shingles be prevented with shingrix vaccine
question_variation_1: can you get shingrix vaccine to prevent recurrence
question_variation_2: can you shingles vaccine prevent recurrence?
